alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PLACER...EL DORADO...SOUTHERN WASHOE...AND DOUGLAS COUNTIES AND WESTERN CARSON CITY THROUGH 230 PM PDT... At 159 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Tahoe, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tahoe City, Kings Beach, Incline Village-Crystal Bay, Carnelian Bay, Sugar Pine Point S, Glenbrook, Homewood, William Kent Campground, Dollar Point, Meeks Bay, Tahoe State Rec Area Campground, Meeks Bay Campground, and Sunnyside-Tahoe City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Tahoe, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
